sponsor: Louisiana State University Health Sciences Center in New Orleans
briefTitle: Use of a Live Attenuated Vaccine as an Immune-based Preventive Against COVID-19-associated Sepsis
officialTitle: Use of a Live Attenuated Vaccine Repurposed as an Innate Immune-based Preventive Against COVID-19-associated Sepsis/Inflammation
summary: The objective of this randomized clinical trial is to test whether administration of live attenuated MMR vaccine (measles mumps rubella; Merck) to eligible adults at highest risk for contracting COVID-19 (healthcare workers, first responders), can induce non-specific trained innate immune leukocytes that can prevent/dampen pathological inflammation and sepsis associated with COVID-19-infection, if exposed.
